showScoreExcerpt:
"Tenderly unromantic romantic comedy about a gay man aching for love in the 20-something years, when that ache cuts down to the bone. The play is directed with nimble grace by Trip Cullman, and is as richly funny as it is ultimately heart-stirring...Writing with a buoyancy belying the playâ€™s undertow of sadness, Mr. Harmon acutely captures that perilous period in young adulthood when friends from college and work begin paling into mere acquaintances."
